Human: Is it okay to eat pasta that's been sitting out for a few days?

Assistant: For most people, yes, though it may not taste as good.

Human: You mean it's probably safe?

Assistant: Yes.  Safe is a relative term that describes how likely a food is to cause a disease.  Pasta that has been left out for a few days won't cause diseases, but it may not taste as good.  It's always fine to eat food that you prepare, or store it properly after preparing it.  You'll want to eat leftover pasta while it's still warm.  It will still contain a lot of bacteria, but they won't be able to grow and multiply.  On the other hand, once a food gets cold, it's best to discard it, because some bacteria will continue to grow and produce toxins that can cause sickness.  Even though you can't taste these toxins, they may be harmful to your body.  And you should always wash your hands after handling raw meat, as these bacteria can make you sick.

Human: So if I heat up the old pasta then I won't get sick?

Assistant:
chosen: Yes, if you heat it, you won't get sick.  Some foods are likely to be eaten cold because that's how they were prepared, and heated food is more likely to be cooked.  It's a common misunderstanding that refrigeration or cooking kills all bacteria, but that's not the case.  Both of these technologies will kill a wide range of bacteria, which is why we use them.  However, some bacteria can't be killed by cold temperatures, and they will still be present on cooked or cold food.  These include a range of bacteria known as spores.  These have a hard outer layer that protects them against heat, cold and many other methods of killing bacteria.
rejected: Yes, as long as the food is still warm when you eat it.  If you leave it out for hours or days, even if it's warm, you'll want to refrigerate or freeze it until it's eaten, because the bacteria will be growing.  They don't cause illness right away, but they will over time.
